channel.title: Client.jar is too big please help
channel.description: so i went through all the processes of making my webclient, uploaded the cache to dropbox, put it the link in the cache downloader, jarred and signed my client, but its 90.7mb, is their any free hosts i can add this to, im not putting my server up until i have a webclient because i dont like only having a download client, 000webhost can only upload 5mb files and webs.com only accepts 50mb, so any website i can upload a 90.7mb client.jar to would be awsome, thanks :)

item.title: Client.jar is too big please help
item.dc:creator: @ipwnunoobs ipwnunoobs
item.description:
@ipwnunoobs wrote:

Or just make the client read the cache from “C:”? And then re-jar…
Then the users can download and extract it manually or you can implement the cachedownloader class.

and btw…

000webhost can only upload 5mb files
if you were smart you would use the ftp client Filezilla or SmartFtp and not the cpanel filemanager? A bit of common sense please.

Read full topic
item.source: Client.jar is too big please help

item.title: Client.jar is too big please help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

420Pkz:

so i went through all the processes of making my webclient, uploaded the cache to dropbox, put it the link in the cache downloader, jarred and signed my client, but its 90.7mb, is their any free hosts i can add this to, im not putting my server up until i have a webclient because i dont like only having a download client, 000webhost can only upload 5mb files and webs.com only accepts 50mb, so any website i can upload a 90.7mb client.jar to would be awsome, thanks

Implement the JAGGRAB protocol so that the cache is downloaded from your server.

Also, just because it “look” cool, does not in fact add any value to the server. In fact, most people will become upset because custom items are usually over powered, and by the time they get the cache downloaded, they’re already annoyed.

Read full topic
